noun.name: bench
noun.discription: a long seat for two or more people, typically made of wood, stone, or metal

object1.name: chair
object1.discription: in parallel with 'bench', is a piece of furniture for one person to sit on, typically with a back and four legs

object2.name: table
object2.discription: in parallel with 'bench', is a piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs, providing a surface for eating, writing, or working

object3.name: sofa
object3.discription: in parallel with 'bench', is a long upholstered seat with a back and arms, for two or more people

object4.name: stool
object4.discription: in parallel with 'bench', is a seat without a back or arms, typically resting on three or four legs

object5.name: desk
object5.discription: in parallel with 'bench', is a piece of furniture with a flat or sloping surface, used for reading, writing, or working at

object6.name: bed
object6.discription: in parallel with 'bench', is a piece of furniture for sleeping or resting on, typically consisting of a mattress on a bed frame

object7.name: couch
object7.discription: in parallel with 'bench', is a long upholstered seat with a back and arms, for two or more people, similar to a sofa but often more informal

object8.name: futon
object8.discription: in parallel with 'bench', is a mattress that can be used as a seat during the day and a bed at night, typically placed on the floor or a low frame
